intro.p: Suppose {{t}} is a mysterious number about which we only know that {{t}}^{ 1/{{b}} } = {{pow}}.
(You should do this problem without first solving this for {{t}}.)

content.p: Use what we know about {{t}} to find the numerical value of your answer to the previous question.
Now suppose {{u}} is another mysterious number about which we only know that {{u}} is negative.
Exactly one of the following expressions is positive; one is negative; and the third is not a real number at all.
Determine which one is which, and write 2-3 sentences explaining your reasoning.

outtro.p: When {{u}} is a negative real number, we know that...
\qquad {{u}}^{ {{whichpos}} } is positive since it is an even power of {{u}}'s odd root;
\qquad {{u}}^{ {{whichneg}} } is negative since it is an odd power of {{u}}'s odd root;
\qquad {{u}}^{ {{whichund}} } is undefined (not real) since it is an even root of a negative number.
